verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of Agur <WH94> the son <WH1121> of Jakeh, <WH3348> even the prophecy: <WH4853> the man <WH1397> spoke <WH5002> to Ithiel, <WH384> even to Ithiel <WH384> and Ucal, <WH401>
Surely <WH3588> I am more brutish <WH1197> than any man, <WH376> and have not the understanding <WH998> of a man. <WH120>
I neither <WH3808> learned <WH3925> wisdom, <WH2451> nor have the knowledge <WH1847> of the holy. <WH6918>

Who <WH4310> has ascended <WH5927> up into heaven, <WH8064> or descended? <WH3381> who <WH4310> has gathered <WH622> the wind <WH7307> in his fists? <WH2651> who <WH4310> has bound <WH6887> the waters <WH4325> in a garment? <WH8071> who <WH4310> has established <WH6965> all <WH3605> the ends <WH657> of the earth? <WH776> what <WH4100> is his name, <WH8034> and what <WH4100> is his son's <WH1121> name, <WH8034> if you can tell? <WH3045>
Every <WH3605> word <WH565> of God <WH433> is pure: <WH6884> he is a shield <WH4043> to them that put their trust <WH2620> in him.
Add <WH3254> you not to his words, <WH1697> lest <WH6435> he reprove <WH3198> you, and you be found a liar. <WH376> <WH3576>
Two <WH8147> things have I required <WH7592> of you; deny <WH4513> me them not before <WH2962> I die: <WH4191>

Remove <WH7368> far <WH7369> from me vanity <WH7723> and lies: <WH3576> give <WH5414> me neither <WH408> poverty <WH7389> nor riches; <WH6239> feed <WH2963> me with food <WH3899> convenient <WH2706> for me:

Lest <WH6435> I be full, <WH7646> and deny <WH3584> you, and say, <WH559> Who <WH4310> is the LORD? <WH3068> or lest <WH6435> I be poor, <WH3423> and steal, <WH1589> and take <WH8610> the name <WH8034> of my God <WH430> in vain.
Accuse <WH3960> not a servant <WH5650> to his master, <WH113> lest <WH6435> he curse <WH7043> you, and you be found guilty. <WH816>
There is a generation <WH1755> that curses <WH7043> their father, <WH1> and does not bless <WH1288> their mother. <WH517>
There is a generation <WH1755> that are pure <WH2889> in their own eyes, <WH5869> and yet is not washed <WH7364> from their filthiness. <WH6675>
There is a generation, <WH1755> O how <WH4100> lofty <WH7311> are their eyes! <WH5869> and their eyelids <WH6079> are lifted <WH5375> up.

There is a generation, <WH1755> whose teeth <WH8127> are as swords, <WH2719> and their jaw <WH4973> teeth <WH4973> as knives, <WH3979> to devour <WH398> the poor <WH6041> from off the earth, <WH776> and the needy <WH34> from among men. <WH120>

The horse leach <WH5936> has two <WH8147> daughters, <WH1323> crying, Give, <WH3051> give. <WH3051> There are three <WH7969> things that are never <WH3808> satisfied, <WH7646> yes, four <WH702> things say <WH559> not, It is enough: <WH1952>
The grave; <WH7585> and the barren <WH6115> womb; <WH7356> the earth <WH776> that is not filled <WH7646> with water; <WH4325> and the fire <WH784> that said <WH559> not, It is enough. <WH1952>

The eye <WH5869> that mocks <WH3932> at his father, <WH1> and despises <WH936> to obey <WH3349> his mother, <WH517> the ravens <WH6158> of the valley <WH5158> shall pick <WH5365> it out, and the young <WH1121> eagles <WH5404> shall eat <WH398> it.
There be three <WH7969> things which are too wonderful <WH6381> for me, yes, four <WH702> which I know <WH3045> not:

The way <WH1870> of an eagle <WH5404> in the air; <WH8064> the way <WH1870> of a serpent <WH5175> on a rock; <WH6697> the way <WH1870> of a ship <WH591> in the middle <WH3820> of the sea; <WH3220> and the way <WH1870> of a man <WH1397> with a maid. <WH5959>

Such <WH3651> is the way <WH1870> of an adulterous <WH5003> woman; <WH802> she eats, <WH398> and wipes <WH4229> her mouth, <WH6310> and said, <WH559> I have done <WH6466> no <WH3808> wickedness. <WH205>
For three <WH7969> things the earth <WH776> is disquieted, <WH7264> and for four <WH702> which it cannot <WH3808> <WH3201> bear: <WH5375>
For a servant <WH5650> when <WH3588> he reigns; <WH4427> and a fool <WH5036> when <WH3588> he is filled <WH7646> with meat; <WH3899>
For an odious <WH8130> woman when <WH3588> she is married; <WH1166> and an handmaid <WH8198> that is heir <WH3423> to her mistress. <WH1404>
There be four <WH702> things which are little <WH6996> on the earth, <WH776> but they are exceeding wise: <WH2450>
The ants <WH5244> are a people <WH5971> not strong, <WH5794> yet they prepare <WH3559> their meat <WH3899> in the summer; <WH7019>
The conies <WH8227> are but a feeble <WH3808> <WH6099> folk, <WH5971> yet make <WH7760> they their houses <WH1004> in the rocks; <WH5553>
The locusts <WH697> have no <WH369> king, <WH4428> yet go <WH3318> they forth <WH3318> all <WH3605> of them by bands; <WH2686>
The spider <WH8079> takes <WH8610> hold <WH8610> with her hands, <WH3027> and is in kings' <WH4428> palaces. <WH1964>
There be three <WH7969> things which go <WH3190> well, <WH3190> yes, four <WH702> are comely <WH3190> in going: <WH3212>
A lion <WH3918> which is strongest <WH1368> among beasts, <WH929> and turns <WH7725> not away for any; <WH3605>
A greyhound; <WH2223> <WH4975> an he goat <WH8495> also; <WH176> and a king, <WH4428> against <WH5973> whom <WH5973> there is no <WH510> rising <WH510> up.
If <WH518> you have done foolishly <WH5034> in lifting <WH5375> up yourself, or if <WH518> you have thought <WH2161> evil, lay your hand <WH3027> on your mouth. <WH6310>

Surely <WH3588> the churning <WH4330> of milk <WH2461> brings <WH3318> forth <WH3318> butter, <WH2529> and the wringing <WH4330> of the nose <WH639> brings <WH3318> forth <WH3318> blood: <WH1818> so the forcing <WH4330> of wrath <WH639> brings <WH3318> forth <WH3318> strife. <WH7379>
